notes: Each formula object includes: 'name' (what it is), 'formula' (mathematical form), 'terms' (each symbol explained with units), and 'description' (short explanation of the relation).

formulas.name: Dimensional formula of a quantity

terms.a,b,c: exponents specific to the quantity (integers or fractions)

formulas.description: Expresses any physical quantity in base dimensions of mass (M), length (L), and time (T). Example: Force has dimensions M L T^-2.

formulas.name: Percent error / Percentage uncertainty
formulas.description: Gives relative deviation of measured value from true value as a percent.

formulas.name: Significant figures (rule summary)

terms.sig_figs: number of meaningful digits in a measured value

formulas.description: Rules determine how many digits are reliable in a measurement (e.g., leading zeros not significant, trailing zeros significant if decimal point present).

formulas.name: Displacement - time relation (constant acceleration)
formulas.description: Gives displacement after time t when acceleration a is constant and initial velocity is u.

formulas.name: Final velocity (constant acceleration)
formulas.description: Relates initial and final velocities under constant acceleration.

formulas.name: Velocity–displacement relation (no time)
formulas.description: Links velocities and displacement without explicit time when acceleration is constant.

formulas.name: Average velocity (constant acceleration)
formulas.description: For constant acceleration, average velocity is arithmetic mean of initial and final velocities.

formulas.name: Projectile motion — horizontal & vertical components
formulas.formula: u_x = u cosθ,  u_y = u sinθ,  t_total = (2 u sinθ) / g,  Range R = (u^2 sin 2θ)/g,  Max height H = (u^2 sin^2 θ)/(2g)

terms.θ: launch angle measured from horizontal (radians or degrees)

formulas.description: Standard relations for projectile motion (neglects air resistance).

formulas.name: Relative velocity (one-dimensional)

terms.v_{A/B}: velocity of A relative to B (m/s)
terms.v_A: velocity of A in the chosen frame (m/s)
terms.v_B: velocity of B in the chosen frame (m/s)

formulas.description: Gives relative speed and direction of A as seen from B.

formulas.name: Newton's Second Law (general)

terms.F: net force vector on object (N = kg·m/s^2)

formulas.description: Net force on an object equals mass times acceleration; vector relation.

formulas.name: Momentum
formulas.description: Momentum is product of mass and velocity; conserved in isolated system.

formulas.name: Impulse
formulas.description: Impulse equals change in momentum; force acting for time Δt changes momentum.

formulas.name: Friction — limiting static friction and kinetic friction
formulas.formula: f_s(max) = μ_s N,  f_k = μ_k N
formulas.description: Static friction adjusts up to its maximum; kinetic friction acts during sliding (usually μ_k < μ_s).

formulas.name: Work done by constant force
formulas.formula: W = F ⋅ s = F s cosφ

terms.φ: angle between force and displacement vectors (radians or degrees)

formulas.description: Scalar product of force and displacement; positive when force has component along displacement.

formulas.name: Kinetic Energy
formulas.description: Energy associated with motion of mass m at speed v.

formulas.name: Work–Energy theorem

terms.W_net: net work done by all forces on object (J)

formulas.description: Net work done equals change in kinetic energy.

formulas.name: Power (instantaneous)
formulas.description: Power is rate at which work is done; for force F on object with velocity v, P = F·v.

formulas.name: Potential energy (gravitational near Earth)
formulas.description: Work required to lift mass m by height h in uniform gravitational field near Earth's surface.

formulas.name: Center of mass (discrete)

terms.R_cm: position vector of center of mass (m)

formulas.description: Weighted average position of mass distribution for system of particles.

formulas.name: Torque (moment of force)
formulas.formula: τ = r × F,  |τ| = r F sinθ

terms.r: position vector from axis to point of force application (m)

formulas.description: Torque measures tendency of force to produce rotation about an axis.

formulas.name: Rotational kinematics (constant angular accel)
formulas.description: Analogues of linear kinematic equations applied to rotation with constant angular acceleration.

formulas.name: Moment of inertia (discrete)

terms.I: moment of inertia about chosen axis (kg·m^2)

formulas.description: Measure of an object's resistance to angular acceleration about an axis.

formulas.name: Rotational dynamics (Newton's 2nd for rotation)
formulas.description: Net torque on rigid body equals moment of inertia times angular acceleration.

formulas.name: Rotational kinetic energy
formulas.description: Energy stored in rotation of rigid body.

formulas.name: Universal law of gravitation

terms.F: magnitude of gravitational force between two masses (N)

formulas.description: Mutual attractive force between any two point masses separated by distance r.

formulas.name: Gravitational potential energy (two masses)
formulas.description: Potential energy of two masses due to mutual gravitational attraction (zero at infinite separation).

formulas.name: Acceleration due to gravity near Earth's surface

terms.g: acceleration due to gravity at Earth's surface (m/s^2)

formulas.description: Derives surface gravitational acceleration from Earth's mass and radius.

formulas.name: Orbital speed (circular orbit)
formulas.description: Speed required for circular orbit around mass M at radius r.

chapters.chapter: Properties of Bulk Matter (Elasticity, Fluid Mechanics basics)

formulas.name: Stress (normal)
formulas.description: Force per unit area applied perpendicular to surface.

formulas.name: Strain (linear)
formulas.description: Fractional change in length under tensile/compressive load.

formulas.name: Hooke's law (elastic limit)
formulas.description: Within elastic limit, stress is proportional to strain; E is material stiffness.

formulas.name: Pressure in fluid at depth
formulas.description: Hydrostatic pressure increases linearly with depth in incompressible fluid.

formulas.name: Buoyant force (Archimedes' principle)
formulas.description: Upthrust equals weight of fluid displaced by submerged portion of object.

formulas.name: Zeroth/First law — change in internal energy (1st law)

terms.ΔU: change in internal energy of system (J)
terms.Q: heat added to the system (J) (positive if added)
terms.W: work done by the system (J) (positive if done by system)

formulas.description: First law of thermodynamics: energy conservation; heat input increases internal energy or does work.

formulas.name: Work done in quasi-static expansion (pressure-volume)
formulas.description: Area under P-V curve gives work done during volume change.

formulas.name: Specific heat relation
formulas.description: Heat required to raise temperature of mass m by ΔT at specific heat c.

formulas.name: Latent heat

terms.Q: heat absorbed or released during phase change (J)

formulas.description: Heat required per unit mass for phase change at constant temperature.

formulas.name: Ideal gas equation (molar form)
formulas.description: Equation of state for ideal gases relating P, V, and T for n moles.

formulas.name: Kinetic theory — average translational kinetic energy per molecule
formulas.description: Relates microscopic kinetic energy of gas molecules to macroscopic temperature.

formulas.name: Relation between pressure and molecular motion
formulas.description: Derived from kinetic theory for ideal gas relating pressure to molecular speeds.

formulas.name: Simple Harmonic Motion (SHM) displacement

terms.x(t): displacement from equilibrium at time t (m)

formulas.description: General solution for displacement in SHM.

formulas.name: Angular frequency and period
formulas.description: Connects angular frequency with period and frequency.

formulas.name: SHM for mass–spring
formulas.formula: ω = sqrt(k / m),  T = 2π sqrt(m / k)
formulas.description: Natural frequency and period for ideal mass-spring oscillator (no damping).

formulas.name: Wave speed (linear medium)
formulas.description: Relation between speed, frequency and wavelength for any wave.
